add.info: add files to csproj if needed.

clean.info: remove files to csproj if needed.

compile.info: Two modes are available. FAT or SLIM. FAT compile the whole solution. SLIM only compile with the linked references.

csc.info: This command allow quick build for aside development, on selected files to link with csc.exe compiler. Pick a project name to start. It is going to create a new project in _runtime folder with a main and a reference file, that is going to have all the solution files listed. Then you need to compile with --slim or --fat. --fat select all the referenced files. --slim only run files that are not commented in the reference file. You can comment these references manaually or you enable them with --link parameter. for --slim and --fat an exe file is created and is runned. --run only run the executable that have been created. For --fat, --slim, and --run you can select the --params that is going to send parameters to the executable created. This commands create a standalone cli program by extracting a subset of the current solution.

db.info: wrapper access to entity db. If no cmd is given help is displayed.

link.info: Gives Keywords to help findind the reference files for linking

params.info: Add params for the file compiled with run command

path_csproj.info: main path where .csproj is located, if not given current path is selected

profile.info: profiles are 'debug, dev, proxy, release, test

publish.info: if you add the --deploy argument then deploy will be executed only if the publish build is new, or webconfig has been modified or pre-deploy scripts has been executed

push.info: given a json array of either string path or dictionary with src path and dst path, then push only those path to direpa_deploy instead of the whole project

slim.info: select reference to add to the project with keywords using --link parameters or manually edit the file in the _runtime/project_name/conf/project_name.conf file.

update.info: delete and add files to csproj if needed.
